entry.title: Topre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Topre's conical-spring capacitive keyboard switch (example pictured) was inspired by a mosquito coil?

entry.title: 1936 Northeast Flood (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1936 Northeast Flood directly led to the passage of the Flood Control Act of 1936?

entry.title: Natalis Constant Darche (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that with a force of just 3,500 men, French lieutenant colonel Natalis Constant Darche was able to hold up the advance of the German 5th Army for three weeks at Longwy in August 1914?

entry.title: The Incredible Hulk: The Pantheon Saga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Piecemeal, who appeared in The Incredible Hulk: The Pantheon Saga, was considered one of the strangest characters to appear in a Marvel video game?

entry.title: The End of Illa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to science fiction essayist Jacques Van Herp, the novella The End of Illa caused the temporary decline of French science fiction?

entry.title: Donald McGuire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mother Teresa defended Jesuit priest and child molester Donald McGuire against sexual abuse allegations?

entry.title: statue of Minerva (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1987, fans of C.D. Guadalajara attempted to dress the statue of Minerva in the team's shirt?

entry.title: Richard John Andrews (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lieutenant Colonel Richard John Andrews survived the Second Boer War, the First World War, the Russian Civil War and the Irish War of Independence only to be killed by a defective tool in his garage?
